intro: Psychotria rubra var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
